verses.text_plain: Hear the right, O Lord, attend unto my cry, give ear unto my prayer, that goeth not out of feigned lips.
verses.verse_html:
1Hear the right, O Lord, attend unto my cry, give ear unto my prayer, that goeth not out of feigned lips. ▼
▼ the right: Heb. justice
 , ▼
▼ not…: Heb. without lips of deceit

footnotes.body_html: ▼ the right: Heb. justice

footnotes.body_text: ▼ not…: Heb. without lips of deceit
footnotes.body_html: ▼ not…: Heb. without lips of deceit

verses.text_plain: Let my sentence come forth from thy presence; let thine eyes behold the things that are equal.
verses.verse_html: 2Let my sentence come forth from thy presence; let thine eyes behold the things that are equal.

verses.text_plain: Thou hast proved mine heart; thou hast visited me in the night; thou hast tried me, and shalt find nothing; I am purposed that my mouth shall not transgress.
verses.verse_html: 3Thou hast proved mine heart; thou hast visited me in the night; thou hast tried me, and shalt find nothing; I am purposed that my mouth shall not transgress.

verses.text_plain: Concerning the works of men, by the word of thy lips I have kept me from the paths of the destroyer.
verses.verse_html: 4Concerning the works of men, by the word of thy lips I have kept me from the paths of the destroyer.

verses.text_plain: Hold up my goings in thy paths, that my footsteps slip not.
verses.verse_html:
5Hold up my goings in thy paths, that my footsteps slip not. ▼
▼ slip…: Heb. be not moved

footnotes.body_html: ▼ slip…: Heb. be not moved

verses.text_plain: I have called upon thee, for thou wilt hear me, O God: incline thine ear unto me, and hear my speech.
verses.verse_html: 6I have called upon thee, for thou wilt hear me, O God: incline thine ear unto me, and hear my speech.

tokens.text: upon thee, for thou wilt hear

verses.text_plain: Shew thy marvellous lovingkindness, O thou that savest by thy right hand them which put their trust in thee from those that rise up against them.
verses.verse_html:
7Shew thy marvellous lovingkindness, O thou that savest by thy right hand them which put their trust in thee from those that rise up against them. ▼
▼ by thy…: or, them which trust in thee from those that rise up against thy right hand

footnotes.body_text: ▼ by thy…: or, them which trust in thee from those that rise up against thy right hand
footnotes.body_html: ▼ by thy…: or, them which trust in thee from those that rise up against thy right hand

verses.text_plain: Keep me as the apple of the eye, hide me under the shadow of thy wings,
verses.verse_html: 8Keep me as the apple of the eye, hide me under the shadow of thy wings,

verses.text_plain: From the wicked that oppress me, from my deadly enemies, who compass me about.
verses.verse_html:
9From the wicked that oppress me, from my deadly enemies, who compass me about. ▼
▼ oppress: Heb. waste
 , ▼
▼ my…: Heb. my enemies against the soul

footnotes.body_text: ▼ my…: Heb. my enemies against the soul
footnotes.body_html: ▼ my…: Heb. my enemies against the soul

verses.text_plain: They are inclosed in their own fat: with their mouth they speak proudly.
verses.verse_html: 10They are inclosed in their own fat: with their mouth they speak proudly.

verses.text_plain: They have now compassed us in our steps: they have set their eyes bowing down to the earth;
verses.verse_html: 11They have now compassed us in our steps: they have set their eyes bowing down to the earth;

verses.text_plain: Like as a lion that is greedy of his prey, and as it were a young lion lurking in secret places.
verses.verse_html:
12Like as a lion that is greedy of his prey, and as it were a young lion lurking in secret places. ▼
▼ Like…: Heb. The likeness of him (that is, of every one of them) is as a lion that desireth to ravin
 , ▼
▼ lurking: Heb. sitting

tokens.text: and as it were a young lion

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Like…: Heb. The likeness of him (that is, of every one of them) is as a lion that desireth to ravin
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Like…: Heb. The likeness of him (that is, of every one of them) is as a lion that desireth to ravin

verses.text_plain: Arise, O Lord, disappoint him, cast him down: deliver my soul from the wicked, which is thy sword:
verses.verse_html:
13Arise, O Lord, disappoint him, cast him down: deliver my soul from the wicked, which is thy sword: ▼
▼ disappoint…: Heb. prevent his face
 , ▼
▼ which is: or, by

footnotes.body_html: ▼ disappoint…: Heb. prevent his face
▼ which is: or, by

verses.text_plain: From men which are thy hand, O Lord, from men of the world, which have their portion in this life, and whose belly thou fillest with thy hid treasure: they are full of children, and leave the rest of their substance to their babes.
verses.verse_html:
14From men which are thy hand, O Lord, from men of the world, which have their portion in this life, and whose belly thou fillest with thy hid treasure: they are full of children, and leave the rest of their substance to their babes. ▼
▼ which are: or, by
 , ▼
▼ they…: or, their children are full

footnotes.body_html: ▼ which are: or, by

footnotes.body_text: ▼ they…: or, their children are full
footnotes.body_html: ▼ they…: or, their children are full

verses.text_plain: As for me, I will behold thy face in righteousness: I shall be satisfied, when I awake, with thy likeness.
verses.verse_html: 15As for me, I will behold thy face in righteousness: I shall be satisfied, when I awake, with thy likeness.

tokens.text: As for me, I will behold
